title.en: Safe Handling and Application of Plant Protection Products in Gardening

displayParameter.summaryDisplay: Safe Handling and Application of Plant Protection Products

title: Safe Handling and Application of Plant Protection Products in Gardening
accreditedCompetence: The learner is capable of safely handling and applying plant protection products (pesticides) in gardening and landscaping environments, in compliance with occupational safety and environmental regulations.
learningOutcomes: Identify the main types of plant protection products and their associated hazards.
Interpret labels, safety data sheets, and hazard pictograms.
Apply correct procedures for preparation, dosage, and application of phytosanitary products.
Implement personal protective measures and environmental risk mitigation strategies.
Carry out basic incident response and waste disposal actions in accordance with legal standards.
assessmentEvidence: Completion of a theory-based module with applied case scenarios.
Practical demonstration of safe application in a controlled or simulated setting.
Summative assessment including a multiple-choice test and observed practical task.
targetLearners: Adult learners in vocational education and training (VET)
Entry-level agricultural and environmental service workers
relationshipToQualifications: Green Space Management and Environmental Services
